title: November 12, 2024 — Budgets: Support for cloud provider queue and webhook notifications | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: You can now configure your account budget and custom budgets so that notifications are sent to the following:
A queue provided by a cloud service (Amazon SNS, Azure Event Grid, or Google Cloud PubSub).
A webhook for Slack, Microsoft Teams, or PagerDuty.

To do this, you create a notification integration for a queue or a
webhook, and you call a method to associate the integration with the
budget. The BUDGET class now supports the following new methods:
Adds a queue or webhook notification integration to a custom budget or the account budget.

Returns information about the queue and webhook notification integrations associated with a custom budget or the account
budget.
Removes a queue or webhook notification integration from a custom budget or the account budget.
For information, see Working with notifications for a budget.
